Beginner.Tutorial 2: Getting to grips with frame-: Familiarising yourself with the FrameLib library.
Beginner.Tutorial 3: FrameLib basics: The basics of FrameLib, such as its timing and patching architecture.
Beginner.Tutorial 4: Getting in and out of FrameL: Methods for converting data between the Max and FrameLib domains.
Beginner.Tutorial 5: Generator objects: An overview of 'generator' objects belonging to the FrameLib eco-system.
Beginner.Tutorial 6: Building a granular synthesi: A step-by-step guide to building a granular synthesiser in Framelib from scratch.

Intermediate.Tutorial 7: FFT with FrameLib: The Basics of FFT/STFT processing in FrameLib
Intermediate.Tutorial 8: Multi-stream processing: Similar to 'mc' objects, multi-streaming allows you to manipulate multiple streams with a single set of processors.

Advanced.Tutorial 9: Multi-resolution FFT: Constructing multi-resolution FFT processes in FrameLib.
Advanced.Tutorial 10: Contexts: Managing FrameLib 'contexts', a concept that is crucical to multithreading and non-realtime processing.
Advanced.Tutorial 11: Non-realtime networks in Fr: Designing, converting and understanding FrameLib networks in the non-realtime mode.
Advanced.Tutorial 13: Exporting FrameLib from Max: Exporting your FrameLib networks from Max to C++ to be used in other environments and applications.
